What to Submit

Hosted website link (GitHub Pages) ‚Äî multi‚Äëpage portfolio built with Quarto.

URL: https://.github.io//

Single‚Äëpage portfolio link (from Assignment 1) ‚Äî paste your URL:

URL: https://.github.io//

Reflection ‚Äî already included as reflection.qmd. Export to PDF if required by your LMS.
Appendix (LLM output, annotated) ‚Äî already included as appendix.qmd with LLM disclosure and revision notes.

title: Submission Package ‚Äî Assignment 3
section: How to Host on GitHub Pages (Quarto)
text:
How to Host on GitHub Pages (Quarto)
# Inside the project folder
quarto preview  # optional local check

git init
git add .
git commit -m "Assignment 3: MBA portfolio"
git branch -M main
git remote add origin https://github.com/<your-username>/<repo-name>.git
git push -u origin main

# Publish to GitHub Pages
quarto publish gh-pages
GitHub Pages URL will look like: https://<your-username>.github.io/<repo-name>/

Notes

title: Sudhanshu Mehta ‚Äî MBA Portfolio
text:
Sudhanshu Mehta




Expanding my single‚Äëpage site into a multi‚Äëpage portfolio improved both clarity and usability. The one‚Äëpage version worked as a snapshot, but it forced everything into one scroll. Separating content into Home, Resume, Projects, Skills, Leadership, Contact, Reflection, and Appendix let me present a clean story: who I am, what I‚Äôve done, and how I work.
I used an LLM to brainstorm the sitemap and first drafts. This helped me avoid blank‚Äëpage syndrome and gave me ideas for small details such as adding a ‚Äúdownload resume‚Äù button and writing short project summaries. As I added pages, I kept the model in a support role. I rewrote the text in my own words, trimmed any generic phrases, and verified every detail (dates, roles, outcomes) against my resume and personal records. This kept the content accurate and authentic.
What worked better as the site grew was the separation of concerns. The Resume page stays focused on core facts, while Projects links to my commercial portfolio, where images and case materials live. The Leadership page captures teaching and speaking highlights that would clutter the Resume. Navigation is simpler, too‚Äîvisitors can jump straight to what they need. I also made small accessibility improvements: good color contrast, readable font sizes, descriptive link text, and responsive images.
To ensure accuracy, I removed any claims I couldn‚Äôt source and limited references to work I can demonstrate. For media, I plan to include only my own images or items I have rights to use. Finally, I saved the LLM site map and drafts in the Appendix with notes on how and why I revised them. This makes the writing process transparent and shows how AI assisted without taking over.
Overall, this assignment taught me to think like a product owner: define the audience, prioritize the most helpful content, and ship a structure I can maintain. The result is a clear and credible portfolio that reflects both my craft and my direction.
